analyzed: ji ltar ji srid du sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams tshogs pa'i dus de srid du sgyu ma yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a magical creation arises for as long as the conditions of mantra, medicine, and so on are assembled,

original: de bzhin du ji srid du ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams tshogs pa de srid du sems can yang 'byung bar 'gyur zhing shi ba rnams kyang slar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji srid du ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams tshogs pa de srid du sems can yang 'byung bar 'gyur zhing shi ba rnams kyang slar skye bar 'gyur ro //

original: gzhan yang yun ring bar gnas pa tsam gyis yang dag pa nyid du yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang yun ring bar gnas pa tsam gyis yang dag pa nyid du yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

original: rgyun ring zhes smos te /
analyzed: rgyun ring zhes smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúFor a long time.‚Äù

original: ring ba ni thog ma med pa nas rgyun skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'o ;
analyzed: ring ba ni thog ma med pa nas rgyun skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'o ;
translated: Long means that it has been a continuum from beginningless time, passing from one instant to the next.

original: / de tsam gyis dam par gzhan ni yun ring du gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / de tsam gyis dam par gzhan ni yun ring du gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: But just because something is like that, it is not necessarily real.

original: ci ste sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir sems can bsad kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci ste sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir sems can bsad kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: If you think that just as a magical person and the person who conjured him are not different in nature, so too there is no fault in killing sentient beings, then:

original: sgyu ma zhes smos te /
analyzed: sgyu ma zhes smos te /
translated: The word illusion is stated.

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang cig shos kyi skyes bu dag dngos po med pa nyid du mtshungs su zin kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i sems med pa'i phyir sdig pa med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang cig shos kyi skyes bu dag dngos po med pa nyid du mtshungs su zin kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i sems med pa'i phyir sdig pa med do //
translated: Although the illusory person and the other person are the same in being unreal, there is no sin for the illusory person because there is no mind of an illusory person.

original: de la yang bsad sems kyis sbyar na nyes par ni 'gyur la srog gcod par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang bsad sems kyis sbyar na nyes par ni 'gyur la srog gcod par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one applies oneself with the intention to kill, there is a fault, but there is no killing.

original: cig shos gzhan la ji ltar srog gcod par 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: cig shos gzhan la ji ltar srog gcod par 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: How can there be killing of the other?

original: sgyu ma'i zhes smos te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i zhes smos te /
translated: The word illusion is stated.

original: sems nyid sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: sems nyid sgyu ma'o //
translated: The mind itself is an illusion.

original: ldan pa ni de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing means possessing that.

original: phan pa dang gnod pa srid pa'i bsod nams la sogs pa'i rten sems yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod pa srid pa'i bsod nams la sogs pa'i rten sems yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind is the basis of merit, etc., which is possible for benefit and harm.

original: gang gi tshe sgyu ma nyid du dngos su mthong ba de'i tshe ni bsad pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgyu ma nyid du dngos su mthong ba de'i tshe ni bsad pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: When one actually sees the illusion, then there is no fault of killing, etc.
Now,

original: dung sems kyis de ltar nus pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshig bzhin du mos pa byed pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: dung sems kyis de ltar nus pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshig bzhin du mos pa byed pa tsam du zad do //
translated: It is not possible by mere love, but it is merely a conviction like the words.

original: pha rol pos sems sgyu ma nyid du mi 'thad par brtsad par 'dod nas /
analyzed: pha rol pos sems sgyu ma nyid du mi 'thad par brtsad par 'dod nas /
translated: Desiring to dispute the non-validity of mind as illusion itself on the part of the opponent,üîΩhe says:

original: sngags la sogs pa la sems bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir sems ni sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du mi srid do //
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa la sems bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir sems ni sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du mi srid do //
translated: ‚ÄúSince there is no power to generate mind by means of mantras, etc., mind is not possible as the nature of illusion.‚Äù

original: lan brjod pa /
analyzed: lan brjod pa /
translated: The reply is stated:

original: sna tshogs zhes brjod de /
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes brjod de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe various‚Äù is stated.

original: rgyu dang rkyen sna tshogs las yang dag par byung ba'i sgyu ma de yang rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen sna tshogs las yang dag par byung ba'i sgyu ma de yang rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: That illusion which arises from various causes and conditions is of various aspects itself.

original: yang zhes pa ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: yang zhes pa ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù is to be connected in order.

original: de lta na sgyu ma'i sgra mtshungs su zin kyang rgyu tha dad pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta na sgyu ma'i sgra mtshungs su zin kyang rgyu tha dad pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, although the word ‚Äúillusion‚Äù is the same, the causes are different.

original: des na sngags la sogs pa'i rgyu las ni gzhan nyid yin la /
analyzed: des na sngags la sogs pa'i rgyu las ni gzhan nyid yin la /

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las ni sems sgyu ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las ni sems sgyu ma nyid yin no //

original: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /

original: rkyen gcig ces smos te /
analyzed: rkyen gcig ces smos te /

analyzed: kha cig tu 'bras bu bskyed par nus pa'i rgyus thams cad du nus pa ma yin no //

analyzed: sgyu ma kha cig ni thog ma med pa nas kyi ma rig pas rab tu bskyed pa'o //

original: de dag kyang tha snyad tsam du brjod par zad do //
analyzed: de dag kyang tha snyad tsam du brjod par zad do //

original: don dam par ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid do //
translated: In the ultimate sense, all phenomena are just nirvana by nature.

original: pha rol pos yang skyon gzhan brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: pha rol pos yang skyon gzhan brjod par 'dod nas /

original: gal te don dam zhes smos te //
analyzed: gal te don dam zhes smos te //
translated: If you say, In the ultimate sense,

original: gdod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir ro //

original: don dam par ni sems can rnams mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin pas 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu tha snyad du brjod par zad do zhes zer ba'i lta na /

analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas la yang 'khor bar skye ba la sogs pa mnga' bar 'gyur ro //

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob nas kyang rga ba la sogs pa yod par 'gyur na ni de ltar na mgo byin pa la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi spyod pa ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob nas kyang rga ba la sogs pa yod par 'gyur na ni de ltar na mgo byin pa la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi spyod pa ci zhig bya ste /

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //

original: de la ji srid rkyen rnams tshogs par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan brjod du zin kyang yang gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩrkyen rnams zhes smos te /
analyzed: de la ji srid rkyen rnams tshogs par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan brjod du zin kyang yang gsal bar bya ba'i phyir / rkyen rnams zhes smos te /
translated: Although the response to this is stated in the lines ‚ÄúAs long as conditions assemble‚Äù and so on, it is stated again here for the sake of clarity.

original: rkyen rnams yod par gyur na yang sgyu ma yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rkyen rnams yod par gyur na yang sgyu ma yang yod pa yin no //
translated: The line ‚ÄúWhen conditions are present, the illusion is present‚Äù means that when the conditions are present, the illusion is present.

original: de bzhin du sems can sgyu ma yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can sgyu ma yang ngo //
translated: Likewise, sentient beings are also like illusions.

original: rkyen rnams med na ni sgyu ma yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen rnams med na ni sgyu ma yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When the conditions are absent, the illusion is not present.

original: de bzhin du @140b sangs rgyas sgyu ma yang rkyen yod kyi bar du mi 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du @140b sangs rgyas sgyu ma yang rkyen yod kyi bar du mi 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, the Buddha, who is like an illusion, does not appear as long as the conditions are absent.

original: sems can gyi bsod nams kyi rkyen gyis rgyal bar snang bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsod nams kyi rkyen gyis rgyal bar snang bar 'byung ngo //
translated: The appearance of the Victor arises through the condition of sentient beings‚Äô merit.

original: de med na ni kun rdzob tu yang mi 'byung ngo //üîΩde ltar re zhig mdo sde la sogs pa'i rtsod pa bsal nas /üîΩda ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i rtsod pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de med na ni kun rdzob tu yang mi 'byung ngo // de ltar re zhig mdo sde la sogs pa'i rtsod pa bsal nas / da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i rtsod pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: If that did not exist, it would not arise even conventionally.üîΩThus, having cleared away the dispute about the s≈´tra collection and so on,

original: de'i rtsod pa bslang bar bzhed nas /üîΩgang tshe zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i rtsod pa bslang bar bzhed nas / gang tshe zhes smos te /
translated: now, in order to clear away the dispute of the YogƒÅcƒÅra,

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni blo la snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni blo la snang ba'o //
translated: the opponent‚Äôs dispute is raised.

original: gang gi tshe sems can thams cad sgyu ma'i rang bzhin yin zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe sgyu ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa'i blo yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems can thams cad sgyu ma'i rang bzhin yin zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe sgyu ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa'i blo yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When all sentient beings are illusory by nature and are empty of intrinsic reality, at that time, the mind that apprehends illusory nature does not exist.

original: de lta na ni sgyu ma gang gis dmigs par byed /
analyzed: de lta na ni sgyu ma gang gis dmigs par byed /
translated: In that case, by what is an illusion observed?

original: des na rang gi sems phyi rol gyi gzugs su 'khrul ba ste /
analyzed: des na rang gi sems phyi rol gyi gzugs su 'khrul ba ste /
translated: Therefore, one‚Äôs mind is deluded as external form.

original: de lta na nyes pa med do snyam pa la de bsal bar bzhed pa lan brjod pa'i phyir gang tshe zhes smos te /
analyzed: de lta na nyes pa med do snyam pa la de bsal bar bzhed pa lan brjod pa'i phyir gang tshe zhes smos te /
translated: To respond to the assertion that there is no fault in that, the reply is stated: ‚ÄúWhen there is no form of an elephant, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba khyod la sgyu ma nyid de gzung bar bya ba glang po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyang med pa'i lta na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba khyod la sgyu ma nyid de gzung bar bya ba glang po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyang med pa'i lta na /
translated: When for you, Proponents of Consciousness, there is no form of an elephant, etc., which is the object of apprehension, even though it is an illusion,

original: sems 'ba' zhig khas blang bar bya dgos te phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems 'ba' zhig khas blang bar bya dgos te phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir ro //

original: de lta na de'i tshe ci zhig dmigs te /
analyzed: de lta na de'i tshe ci zhig dmigs te /

original: 'dir ci zhig so sor snang ba yang brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'dir ci zhig so sor snang ba yang brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Here it must be said what appears individually.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bsam pa'i dgos pa bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bsam pa'i dgos pa bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the intention of the YogƒÅcƒÅra,

original: de ni sems zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ni sems zhes smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThat is mind.‚Äù

original: rang gi sems nyid phyi rol gyi gzugs su 'khrul nas glang po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid phyi rol gyi gzugs su 'khrul nas glang po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba ste /

original: des na de nyid don dam par na sems gzhan zhig yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: des na de nyid don dam par na sems gzhan zhig yod pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, in reality, there is only mind.

original: 'dzin pa las chad pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa las chad pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearance that is cut off from the apprehender appears.üîΩIf,

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni khas mi len na'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni khas mi len na'o //
translated: means if you do not accept that.üîΩEven so, it is not tenable,

original: de lta na yang de 'tsham pa ma yin no zhes lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang de 'tsham pa ma yin no zhes lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: so to demonstrate the response,

original: gang tshe zhes smos te /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes smos te /
translated: he says, When,

original: gang gi tshe shes pa nyid sgyu mar khas blangs pa de'i tshe gzhan gang gis 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa nyid sgyu mar khas blangs pa de'i tshe gzhan gang gis 'dzin par byed /
translated: at that time, when consciousness itself is accepted as an illusion, at that time, by what other [consciousness] is it apprehended?

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i sgyu ma ni rnam par shes pa yin na /üîΩlta bar byed pa med par ji ltar na blta bar bya ba yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i sgyu ma ni rnam par shes pa yin na / lta bar byed pa med par ji ltar na blta bar bya ba yod par 'gyur /
translated: In this way, the illusion that is seen is consciousness.üîΩHow could the object of seeing exist without a seer?

original: blta bar bya ba med par yang ji ltar na lta bar byed pa yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba med par yang ji ltar na lta bar byed pa yod par 'gyur /
translated: How could the seer exist without an object of seeing?

original: des na 'gro ba rnams long ba nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'gro ba rnams long ba nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, beings would be blind.

original: ci ste 'di snyam du shes pa'i bdag gi sgyu ma'i rang bzhin ni /üîΩbdag nyid kyis bdag nyid @141a * //
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du shes pa'i bdag gi sgyu ma'i rang bzhin ni / bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid @141a * //
translated: But if you think that the illusory nature of the self of consciousnessüîΩis seen by the self

original: la lta bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: la lta bar byed pa ni /
translated: of consciousness itself,

original: re zhig nyes pa de dag mi 'ong ngo snyam pa la /
analyzed: re zhig nyes pa de dag mi 'ong ngo snyam pa la /
translated: One might think, For the time being, those faults do not occur.

original: 'jig rten zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes smos te /
translated: To that, the text says in the world.

original: byed pa por gyur pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin de nyid las su byas nas lta ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa por gyur pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin de nyid las su byas nas lta ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical to view the nature of the mind, which is the agent, as the object.

original: rang la rang byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang la rang byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is contradictory for something to act upon itself.

original: 'di skad du rin chen gtsug tor zhes bya ba'i mod las /
analyzed: 'di skad du rin chen gtsug tor zhes bya ba'i mod las /
translated: In this regard, the Ratnatejasutra says:

original: rang gi sems la yongs su dpyad pa byas na nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: rang gi sems la yongs su dpyad pa byas na nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: When one examines one's own mind, one does not see it internally,

original: phyi rol du yang ma yin /
analyzed: phyi rol du yang ma yin /
translated: nor externally,üîΩnor in the aggregates,

original: phung po la yang ma yin /
analyzed: phung po la yang ma yin /
translated: nor in the elements.üîΩ And so on extensively.

original: khams rnams la yang ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs so 'di ci dang 'dra bar snyam pa la ral gri zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khams rnams la yang ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs so 'di ci dang 'dra bar snyam pa la ral gri zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To illustrate what this means, the text says like a sword, and so on.

original: ji ltar ral gri'i so yang rang la rang mi gcod pa de bzhin du yid kyis kyang rang gis rang mi rig ste cha shas med pa la rang bzhin gzhan 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar ral gri'i so yang rang la rang mi gcod pa de bzhin du yid kyis kyang rang gis rang mi rig ste cha shas med pa la rang bzhin gzhan 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the edge of a sword does not cut itself, so too the mind does not perceive itself, because it is contradictory for an entity to have a part that is different from itself.

original: gal te 'di snyam du dper na bum pa la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa'i mar me nyid rang gsal bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du dper na bum pa la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa'i mar me nyid rang gsal bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If you think that, for example, a lamp that illuminates such things as a pot also illuminates itself,

analyzed: yang de gsal bar byed pa'i don du mar me gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba'i rtsod pa bslang bar bya ba'i phyir /

original: sngon po zhes smos te /
analyzed: sngon po zhes smos te /

original: dper na shel gyi rdo ba sngon po nyid du 'gyur ba ni snam bu sngon po la sogs pa rkyen gzhan la ltos mod kyi /üîΩrang bzhin gang zhig sngon po nyid du grub pa de sngon po nyid du byed pa'i phyir /

translated: For example, a crystal ball becomes blue in dependence on other conditions, such as a blue cloth.

original: rkyen gzhan la ltos pa med do //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan la ltos pa med do //

analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar tshor ba po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since there is no experiencer at all,

original: de'i phyir gzhan @151b du mngon par zhen pa las ma gtogs pa'i tshor ba yang dag pa nyid du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan @151b du mngon par zhen pa las ma gtogs pa'i tshor ba yang dag pa nyid du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: therefore, apart from the attachment to another, feeling does not exist in reality.

original: 'di yis zhes pa ni tshor bas so //
analyzed: 'di yis zhes pa ni tshor bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this‚Äù means by feeling.

original: de dag gis ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the mindfulness of feeling.

original: chos yang dag par sdud pa las kyang /
analyzed: chos yang dag par sdud pa las kyang /
translated: The Dharmasangiti-sutra says,

original: tshor ba nyams myong zhes brjod pa //
analyzed: tshor ba nyams myong zhes brjod pa //
translated: ‚ÄúFeeling is said to be experience.

original: tshor bya tshor byed tshor ba rnams //
analyzed: tshor bya tshor byed tshor ba rnams //
translated: The experiencer, the experienced, and feeling

original: so sor gyur pa ma mthong na //
analyzed: so sor gyur pa ma mthong na //
translated: are not seen to be separate.

original: gang gis na nyid nyams su myong //
analyzed: gang gis na nyid nyams su myong //
translated: By what is it experienced?

original: de ltar tshor ba rnams la ni //
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba rnams la ni //
translated: Thus, the wise establish mindfulness

original: mkhas pas dran pa nye bar gzhag //
analyzed: mkhas pas dran pa nye bar gzhag //
translated: with regard to the feelings.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: The verse is commented upon in the same order.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the establishment of mindfulness with regard to the mind, he says:üîΩThe mind is not internal, not external, and not in between the two.

original: yid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The mind is not in the sense faculties, nor in forms, etc.,üîΩnor in between them.

original: dbang po ni shes pa skye ba la bdag po'i tshul gyis dbang byed pa'i don gyis na dbang po'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni shes pa skye ba la bdag po'i tshul gyis dbang byed pa'i don gyis na dbang po'o //
translated: The mind is not internal, because it is not in the sense faculties.

original: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba ni lus las tha dad pa'i gzugs rnams so //üîΩbar na zhes pa ni dbang po dang yul gyi bar na'o //
analyzed: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba ni lus las tha dad pa'i gzugs rnams so // bar na zhes pa ni dbang po dang yul gyi bar na'o //
translated: The mind is not external, because it is not in forms, etc.

original: nang ni lus kyi nang na'o //üîΩphyi na ste lus kyi phyi na'o //
analyzed: nang ni lus kyi nang na'o // phyi na ste lus kyi phyi na'o //
translated: The mind is not in between, because it is not in the space in between the sense faculties and forms, etc.

original: gzhan na ste brjod pa rnams las gzhan na'o //
analyzed: gzhan na ste brjod pa rnams las gzhan na'o //
translated: The mind is not in any other place, because it is not in any other of the above mentioned categories.

original: sems dang yid ni don gcig pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang yid ni don gcig pa'o //
translated: The mind and thought are synonymous.

original: lus dang ldan cig tu 'dres pa ma yin zhing rten tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lus dang ldan cig tu 'dres pa ma yin zhing rten tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind is not mixed with the body, nor is it a different support from the body.

original: dngos po cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist as any thing whatsoever.

original: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi sems ni yod do zhes dgongs pa'o //üîΩde nyid kyi 'thad pa yang stabs gcig chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi sems ni yod do zhes dgongs pa'o // de nyid kyi 'thad pa yang stabs gcig chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: The intention is that the mind, which is of the nature of an illusion, exists conventionally.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the logical possibility of that, he says,

original: shes bya las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes bya las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in one place, the application of mindfulness to the dharmas.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i rim pa'o //üîΩgzhan gyis bden pa gnyis mi 'thad par brtsad par 'dod nas gal te zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i rim pa'o // gzhan gyis bden pa gnyis mi 'thad par brtsad par 'dod nas gal te zhes smos te /
translated: Thus means in the order expressed.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Another, wishing to dispute the untenability of the two truths, says, If all dharmas are devoid of intrinsic reality, then the ultimate truth would be the only truth.

original: bden pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There would not be two truths.

original: yang na don dam pa'i rang bzhin thob pa yang yod la kun rdzob kyang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na don dam pa'i rang bzhin thob pa yang yod la kun rdzob kyang yod pa yin te /
translated: Or, the attainment of the ultimate nature would exist and the conventional would exist.

original: de yang gzhan te rgyud gzhan gyi blos rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de yang gzhan te rgyud gzhan gyi blos rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: Moreover, that is other, established by the intellect of another continuum.

original: des na don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not just the ultimate truth.

original: kun rdzob grub ba'i phyir gnyi ga yang grub pa yin pas bden pa gnyis su rjod par byed pa de lta na ni don dam pa yang blo'i spyod yul du 'gyur la /üîΩblo ni kun rdzob yin @152a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob grub ba'i phyir gnyi ga yang grub pa yin pas bden pa gnyis su rjod par byed pa de lta na ni don dam pa yang blo'i spyod yul du 'gyur la / blo ni kun rdzob yin @152a * //
translated: But if that is so, then the ultimate would be the domain of the mind,üîΩand since the mind is conventional, then at that time even nirvana would be conventional.

original: pas na de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa yang kun rdzob tu 'gyur ba'i phyir de thob nas sems can mya ngan las ga la 'da' ste /
analyzed: pas na de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa yang kun rdzob tu 'gyur ba'i phyir de thob nas sems can mya ngan las ga la 'da' ste /
translated: How could sentient beings transcend suffering by attaining it?

original: gang gis ni grol ba nyid du 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gang gis ni grol ba nyid du 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
translated: One might think, ‚ÄúBy what would one be liberated?‚Äù

original: sgrub pa pos lan brjod pa 'di ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: sgrub pa pos lan brjod pa 'di ni zhes smos te /
translated: The reply of the practitioner is stated:

original: gang gi tshe gzhan gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes mya ngan las 'das pa rtog par byed pa de'i tshe gzhan gyi sems nyid rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pas na des mya ngan las 'das pa yul du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes mya ngan las 'das pa rtog par byed pa de'i tshe gzhan gyi sems nyid rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pas na des mya ngan las 'das pa yul du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When others imagine nirvana, thinking ‚ÄúNirvana is,‚Äù at that time the mind of others is conceptual. Therefore, they do not take nirvana as an object.

original: rang gi kun rdzob ste rang gi rnam par rtog pa la mya ngan las 'das pa de yod min te /
analyzed: rang gi kun rdzob ste rang gi rnam par rtog pa la mya ngan las 'das pa de yod min te /
translated: Nirvana does not exist in one‚Äôs own conventional mind, in one‚Äôs own conception.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all minds and mental factors have ceased.

original: des na mya ngan las 'das pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na mya ngan las 'das pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: So how could nirvana exist?

original: gal te rang la kun rdzob de yod pa ma yin pa de lta na ni gzhan gyi kun rdzob kyang kun rdzob nyid du ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te rang la kun rdzob de yod pa ma yin pa de lta na ni gzhan gyi kun rdzob kyang kun rdzob nyid du ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: If that conventional reality does not exist for you, then how could the conventional reality of others be conventional reality?

original: phyis de zhes smos te /
analyzed: phyis de zhes smos te /
translated: Later, that

original: rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa'i gzhan las skyes pa yin no zhes gang rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos phyis nges par byed pa yin na kun rdzob yod la /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa'i gzhan las skyes pa yin no zhes gang rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos phyis nges par byed pa yin na kun rdzob yod la /
translated: If that which is not imagined arises from another, then later, that which is ascertained to have the characteristic of arising from conditions is conventional reality.

original: gang gi tshe de yang med pa yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de yang med pa yin pa /
translated: But when that does not exist,

original: de'i tshe kun rdzob med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i tshe kun rdzob med pa nyid de /
translated: then conventional reality does not exist.

original: rgyu rkyen 'di las byung zhes bya ba nam mkha'i me thog bzhin du med par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen 'di las byung zhes bya ba nam mkha'i me thog bzhin du med par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is like a sky flower, in that it does not arise from causes and conditions.

original: gal te 'di snyam du skye ba yang med 'gag pa yang med pa'i chos rnams la don dam par shes par byed pa yang yod pa ma yin la shes par bya ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du skye ba yang med 'gag pa yang med pa'i chos rnams la don dam par shes par byed pa yang yod pa ma yin la shes par bya ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that ultimately there is no cognition of things that are neither produced nor ceased, nor is there anything to be cognized,

original: des na ci zhig cis rtogs par byed snyam pa la /
analyzed: des na ci zhig cis rtogs par byed snyam pa la /
translated: then what is cognized by what?

original: rtog dang zhes smos te /
analyzed: rtog dang zhes smos te /
translated: In response, it is said:

original: rtog pa ni blo'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConceptualization‚Äù is the mind.

original: brtag par bya ba ni shes bya'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba ni shes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is to be conceptualized‚Äù is the object of knowledge.

original: de dag gnyis po phan tshun brten pa ni phan tshun ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyis po phan tshun brten pa ni phan tshun ltos pa'o //
translated: Those two are mutually dependent, meaning they rely on each other.

original: ji ltar grags pa la gnas nas te bzung nas 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du rtog par byed kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar grags pa la gnas nas te bzung nas 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du rtog par byed kyi /
translated: Abiding in what is renowned, meaning grasping it, conceptualization is done in terms of worldly conventions.

original: don dam par ni rtog par byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni rtog par byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But ultimately, conceptualization does not exist.

original: gal te rtog par byed pa po yang brtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir des nye bar gzhag pa'i dngos po yang med pa nyid do snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te rtog par byed pa po yang brtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir des nye bar gzhag pa'i dngos po yang med pa nyid do snyam pa la /
translated: If you think that since the agent of conceptualization is itself conceptualized, the thing that is posited by that does not exist,

original: gang tshe zhes smos te /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes smos te /
translated: then it is said:

original: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pas gzhan zhig la brtags nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pas gzhan zhig la brtags nas /
translated: When, by conceptualization, something else is conceptualized,

original: de yang rtog par byed pa gcig gis @152b brtag par bya ba yin na ni de'i tshe yang rtog par byed pa gzhan zhig gis brtag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de yang rtog par byed pa gcig gis @152b brtag par bya ba yin na ni de'i tshe yang rtog par byed pa gzhan zhig gis brtag par bya ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, if it is to be examined by a single examiner, then at that time it is to be examined by another examiner.

original: yang de yang gzhan zhig gis brtag par bya ba yin pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de yang gzhan zhig gis brtag par bya ba yin pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that also is to be examined by another, so there is an infinite regress.

original: dis na rtog par byed pa la ni brtag par bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang brtag par bya ba nyid la'o ;
analyzed: dis na rtog par byed pa la ni brtag par bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang brtag par bya ba nyid la'o ;
translated: But it is not the case that the examiner is not to be examined, but rather the object of examination is.

original: / rnam par brtag par bya ba la brtags pa ni gtan la dbab par bya ba gtan la phebs pa ste /
analyzed: / rnam par brtag par bya ba la brtags pa ni gtan la dbab par bya ba gtan la phebs pa ste /
translated: The examination of the object of examination is the ascertainment of the object to be ascertained.

original: yang dus phyis brtag par bya ba'i gnas ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dus phyis brtag par bya ba'i gnas ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And later there is no basis for examination.

original: gnas med pas na yang rnam par rtog par byed pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas med pas na yang rnam par rtog par byed pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no basis, the engagement of the examiner does not occur.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa med pa de ni mya ngan las 'das par bshad de /
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa med pa de ni mya ngan las 'das par bshad de /
translated: The absence of engagement, etc. is explained as nirvana,

original: des bya ba med par zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bya ba med par zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is peace through the absence of activity.

original: don dam par bden par smra ba gang dag rnam par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: don dam par bden par smra ba gang dag rnam par rtog par byed de /
translated: Those who speak of ultimate truth, who imagine

original: tshad ma dang rnam par brtag par bya ba ste gzhal bar bya ba'o zhes 'di gnyis bden par 'dod pa ni shin tu yang 'khor bar ltung ba yin pa'i phyir gnas med pa ste ngan par gnas pa nyid do //üîΩde nyid brjod pa /
analyzed: tshad ma dang rnam par brtag par bya ba ste gzhal bar bya ba'o zhes 'di gnyis bden par 'dod pa ni shin tu yang 'khor bar ltung ba yin pa'i phyir gnas med pa ste ngan par gnas pa nyid do // de nyid brjod pa /
translated: that there is a valid cognition and an object of comprehension, who assert that these two are real, fall into cyclic existence, and so they are in a bad state, a state that is not tenable.üîΩThis is stated in the following:

original: gal te zhes smos te /
analyzed: gal te zhes smos te /
translated: If you say

original: gal te shes pa tshad ma'i dbang gis te stobs kyis don gzhal bar bya ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i lta na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa tshad ma'i dbang gis te stobs kyis don gzhal bar bya ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i lta na /
translated: that the object of comprehension is posited by the power of valid knowledge,

original: de'i tshe shes pa yod pa nyid du gang gis nges par byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa yod pa nyid du gang gis nges par byed de /
translated: then by what means is the existence of consciousness ascertained?

original: rang gis rang rig pa ni med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rang gis rang rig pa ni med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because there is no reflexive awareness,

original: tshad ma gzhan tshol na yang thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan tshol na yang thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and if you seek another valid cognition, there will be an infinite regress.

original: 'on te shes bya'i dbang gis te gzhal bar bya ba'i stobs kyis tshad ma rnam par 'jog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te shes bya'i dbang gis te gzhal bar bya ba'i stobs kyis tshad ma rnam par 'jog par byed pa ste /
translated: But if you say that valid knowledge is posited by the power of the object of comprehension,üîΩthen what is the point of positing valid knowledge?

original: des na gang gis thug pa med par 'gyur snyam na ni /
analyzed: des na gang gis thug pa med par 'gyur snyam na ni /
translated: Therefore, if one thinks, ‚ÄúHow could there be an infinite regress?‚Äù

original: de'i tshe gzhal bya yod pa nyid du gang gis khong du chud par bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhal bya yod pa nyid du gang gis khong du chud par bya /
translated: At that time, by what means would one understand the existence of the object of cognition?

original: de ste shes pa'i stobs kyis shes bya yod pa nyid du 'jog cing /
analyzed: de ste shes pa'i stobs kyis shes bya yod pa nyid du 'jog cing /
translated: But if one posits the existence of the object of cognition by the power of cognition,

original: shes bya'i stobs kyis shes pa nyid du 'jog go zhe na ni de'i tshe gnyis ka yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes bya'i stobs kyis shes pa nyid du 'jog go zhe na ni de'i tshe gnyis ka yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and posits cognition by the power of the object of cognition, then neither would exist,

original: phan tshun brten pa yin pa'i phyir gcig ma grub pas gnyis pa yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa yin pa'i phyir gcig ma grub pas gnyis pa yang mi 'grub po //
translated: because they mutually depend on each other. Since one is not established, the other is not established.

original: pha med ces pa la sogs pa ni rjes su mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: pha med ces pa la sogs pa ni rjes su mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The example that accords with this is stated in the lines: ‚ÄúWithout a father, there is no son.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig gis bu skyed pa na phar 'gyur gyi /üîΩji srid du ma bskyed kyi bar de srid ni ma yin la /üîΩji srid du pha med par 'gyur gyi bar de srid du bu'i skye ba yang yod @153a * //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis bu skyed pa na phar 'gyur gyi / ji srid du ma bskyed kyi bar de srid ni ma yin la / ji srid du pha med par 'gyur gyi bar de srid du bu'i skye ba yang yod @153a * //
translated: When someone produces a son, he becomes a father.üîΩBut as long as he does not produce a son, he is not a father.

original: pa ma yin pas gnyis ka yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa ma yin pas gnyis ka yang med pa nyid do //
translated: And as long as there is no father, there is no production of a son. Therefore neither exists.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: phan tshun ltos nas gnyis grub pa'i //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos nas gnyis grub pa'i //
translated: The two are established in mutual dependence.

original: gnyis ka'i don dam nyid ma yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i don dam nyid ma yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: But neither is the ultimate reality of both.

original: de bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya dag kyang ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya dag kyang ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, consciousness and the object of consciousness are not established.

original: rgol ba pos brjod pa myu gu zhes smos te /
analyzed: rgol ba pos brjod pa myu gu zhes smos te /
translated: The opponent says: ‚ÄúThe sprout.‚Äù

original: mtshon zhes pa ni go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon zhes pa ni go bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIndicated‚Äù means made known.

original: myu gu nyid bzhin du shes pa'i shes bya yod pa nyid du ci ste rtogs shing goms par mi byed snyam pa la /
analyzed: myu gu nyid bzhin du shes pa'i shes bya yod pa nyid du ci ste rtogs shing goms par mi byed snyam pa la /
translated: Why do you not understand and become familiar with the fact that the object of consciousness exists just like the sprout?

original: sgrub pa pos brjod pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa pos brjod pa /
translated: The proponent of the argument says:

original: myu gu las zhes smos te /
analyzed: myu gu las zhes smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the sprout.‚Äù

original: myu gu las gzhan du gyur pa'i shes pas myu gu shes par byas nas sa bon yod do zhes go bar byed rtogs par byed grang na /
analyzed: myu gu las gzhan du gyur pa'i shes pas myu gu shes par byas nas sa bon yod do zhes go bar byed rtogs par byed grang na /
translated: If you understand and become familiar with the fact that the seed exists by means of a consciousness that is different from the sprout, having made known the sprout by means of consciousness,

original: shes pa yod pa nyid ni gang las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid ni gang las kyang ma yin te /
translated: the existence of consciousness is not from anything at all,

original: rang rig pa med pa'i phyir la shes pa gzhan gyis kyang thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa med pa'i phyir la shes pa gzhan gyis kyang thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no reflexive awareness and because there would be an infinite regress of consciousnesses.

original: brtags pa'i phyogs la ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dgag par mi bya ba nyid yin gyi de kho na nyid du ma yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa'i phyogs la ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dgag par mi bya ba nyid yin gyi de kho na nyid du ma yin no //
translated: In the context of analysis, one should not repudiate the existence of cause and effect even conventionally.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin du smra ba nyid rgyu med par smra ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin du smra ba nyid rgyu med par smra ba ste /
translated: Because the proponents of intrinsic reality are proponents of causelessness.

original: de dag na re 'gro ba sna tshogs ni rgyu med pa nyid yin pa de las rgyu las 'byung ba ga la srid /
analyzed: de dag na re 'gro ba sna tshogs ni rgyu med pa nyid yin pa de las rgyu las 'byung ba ga la srid /

translated: If you think that an arisen entity stops an entity, he says:

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: A non-entity, etc.

original: ma bral na zhes bya ba ni ma spangs na dngos po med pa la /
analyzed: ma bral na zhes bya ba ni ma spangs na dngos po med pa la /
translated: If not separated means if not abandoned, then an entity in a non-entity

original: dngos po ni skye ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni skye ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: is an entity that arises.

original: de bas na skye bo 'di dag thams cad skye ba med cing 'gag pa med par zung bar bya'o //üîΩyang khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na skye bo 'di dag thams cad skye ba med cing 'gag pa med par zung bar bya'o // yang khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, all these people should be understood as non-arisen and unceasing.

original: 'gro ba zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes smos te /
translated: Moreover, in order to teach the distinction, he says:üîΩThe world.

original: 'gro ba ni 'gro ba ris drug go //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'gro ba ris drug go //
translated: The world is the six destinies.

original: de rnams rmi lam 'dra ba ni rmi lam dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de rnams rmi lam 'dra ba ni rmi lam dang mtshungs so //
translated: They are like a dream, they are similar to a dream.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba'o //
translated: Therefore, nirvana is the liberation from the bondage of passion, etc.

original: yang dag de kho na nyid du khyad par med pa ni bye brag med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag de kho na nyid du khyad par med pa ni bye brag med pa'o //
translated: The absence of distinction in reality is the absence of difference.

original: yang kun rdzob tu ni tha dad du yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang kun rdzob tu ni tha dad du yod pa nyid do //
translated: But in the conventional, they do exist as different.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang sems can khams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang sems can khams //
translated: The realms of the Buddhas and of sentient beings
